post.description:
Ask for a completion and stores the prompt in the chat history.

  Replica chat supports two response formats: streamed and JSON. To switch between these formats, use the 'Accept' header, specifying either 'text/event-stream' for streaming or 'application/json' for JSON.
  The streamed response honours the [Stream Protocol](https://sdk.vercel.ai/docs/ai-sdk-ui/stream-protocol), allowing the use of a number of SDKs, including [Vercel AI SDK](https://sdk.vercel.ai/docs/introduction).

  The streamed variant is not specified in the OpenAPI Schema because it is not an OpenAPI endpoint.

content.description: Content of the message must be between 1 and 10000 characters.
content.example: How did you handle the immense pressure during the Civil War?

skip_chat_history.description: When set to true, historical messages are not used in the context, and the message is not appended to the conversation history, thus it is excluded from all future chat context.

source.description: The place where the conversation is happening, which informs where the message should be saved in the chat history.

200.description: List of chat messages had with a replica by the current user, including the completion

example.content: I handled the immense pressure during the Civil War by...
I handled the immense pressure during the Civil War by...

error.description: A text representation of the error

fingerprint.description: A unique identifier of the event, useful for reporting

post.description:
Ask for a completion and stores the prompt in the chat history.

  Replica chat supports two response formats: streamed and JSON. To switch between these formats, use the 'Accept' header, specifying either 'text/event-stream' for streaming or 'application/json' for JSON.
  The streamed response honours the [Stream Protocol](https://sdk.vercel.ai/docs/ai-sdk-ui/stream-protocol), allowing the use of a number of SDKs, including [Vercel AI SDK](https://sdk.vercel.ai/docs/introduction).

  The streamed variant is not specified in the OpenAPI Schema because it is not an OpenAPI endpoint.

content.example: How did you handle the immense pressure during the Civil War?

skip_chat_history.description: When set to true, historical messages are not used in the context, and the message is not appended to the conversation history, thus it is excluded from all future chat context.

post.description:
> warn
  > Limited [OpenAI Chat Completions API](https://platform.openai.com/docs/api-reference/chat/create) compatibility.
  > Supports basic chat completion with standard message roles and JSON responses.
  > Not supported: OpenAI-style streaming, tool calls, stop sequences, logprobs, and most request parameters.

  Creates a chat completion response from a list of messages comprising a conversation.

role.description: The role of the message author. Can be "assistant", "developer", "system", "tool", or "user".

content.example: How did you handle the immense pressure during the Civil War?

name.description: An optional name for the participant. Provides the model information to differentiate between participants of the same role.

messages.description: A list of messages that make up the conversation context. Only the last message is used for completion.

example.content: How did you handle the immense pressure during the Civil War?

store.description: When set to false, historical messages are not used in the context, and the message is not appended to the conversation history.

source.description: The place where the conversation is happening, which informs where the message should be saved in the chat history if `store` is true.

200.description: Chat completion response in OpenAI compatible format

id.description: A unique identifier for the chat completion.

created.description: The Unix timestamp (in seconds) of when the chat completion was created.

object.description: The object type, which is always "chat.completion"

model.description: The model used for the chat completion.

index.description: The index of the choice in the array.

role.description: The role of the message author, which is always "assistant" for completions.

content.example: During the Civil War, I faced tremendous pressure...

tool_calls.description: The tool calls generated by the model, such as function calls.

message.description: The message generated by the model.

logprobs.description: Log probabilities for token generation if requested.

finish_reason.description: The reason the model stopped generating tokens.

choices.description: An array of chat completion choices.

prompt_tokens.description: Number of tokens in the prompt.

completion_tokens.description: Number of tokens in the generated completion.

total_tokens.description: Total number of tokens used (prompt + completion).

usage.description: Usage statistics for the completion request.

schema.description: The response format for chat completions.

success.description: Indicates the status of the request

error.description: A text representation of the error

fingerprint.description: A unique identifier of the event, useful for reporting
